articles.title: Reunification Event Held in S. Korea
Anti-Japanese Rally Held in S. Korea
Rallies of Public Circles Held in S. Korea
Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Peru
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Work Published in Peru 
    Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung's work "Let the North and the South Open the Way to Peace and the Reunification of the Country in a United Effort" was brought out in pamphlet by a Peruvian publishing house to mark the 60th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
 The work is the talk with the delegates of the two sides to the Inter-Korean High-Level Talks on Feb. 20, Juche 81(1992).    
 He clarified in the work that the effectuation of the "Agreement on Reconciliation, Nonaggression, Cooperation and Exchange between North and South" and the "Joint Declaration on the Denuclearization of the Korean Peninsula" is an epochal event which made a milestone for peace and reunification of the country. And he indicated the principled problems arising in achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: Friendship Meeting
Pyongyang Int'l Invitational Table Tennis Tournament Opens
DPRK Players Prove Successful at Universiad
Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassies
Japan�fs Militarist Hysteria under Fire
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassies
    Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Floral baskets were respectively sent to the DPRK missions in the capital cities of Uzbekistan, Vietnam, Ethiopia and Indonesia and other countries by the People's Democratic Party of Uzbekistan, the Vietnam-Korea Friendship Association, the Vietnamese Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, the Vietnam-Korea Friendship Club, the Ethiopian preparatory committee for celebrating the 60th anniversaries of the liberation of Korea and the Workers' Party of Korea, general directors of Indonesian companies including the Badja Machine Co., the Rabitra Bahtera Pratama Co. and the Manager of the Mt. Chilbo Company and figures of political parties and organizations and public circles of various other countries on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of Korea's liberation from August 11 to 15.
 The floral baskets were laid before the portraits of President  Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and their full-length portraits at the missions.

articles.title: KCNA Blasts Japan's "Defense White Paper for 2005"
articles.content:
Japan�fs Militarist Hysteria under Fire
    Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Japan termed the DPRK and China �gthreatening states�h although it is chiefly responsible for threatening peace and stability in Northeast Asia. This is sheer sophism that can be made only by crafty and shameless ones, observes Minju Joson Friday in a signed commentary.
 What the Japan Defense Agency claimed in its defence white paper for 2005 is nothing but sheer lies grossly falsifying truth, the commentary says, and goes on: 
 Japan dubbed the DPRK and China �gthreatening states�h in a bid to invent pretexts for justifying their moves to revive militarism, emerge a military power and realize overseas expansion now being frantically stepped up under the U.S. patronage.
 The moves for reinvasion which the Japanese reactionaries are escalating with their undisguised exceptional zeal for overseas expansion are arousing serious apprehension among members of the international community as they are timed to coincide with the 60th anniversary of Japanese imperialist's defeat.    
 In the white paper Japan painted the DPRK as "a factor of grave instability" and declared Tok Islet, an inalienable part of the territory of Korea, as "a disputed island". This is a blatant provocative act prompted by a sinister intention to put the whole of Korea under its control.    
 The Japanese reactionaries would be well advised to awake from a day-dream.
 If they opt for reinvasion of Korea, seized by militarist zeal for reinvasion, they will only suffer a defeat much more miserable than what they did 60 years ago.
 They should face up to the reality and behave with discretion.

articles.title: Conversion of Revolutionary Ranks into Highly-Efficient Ones Called for
Fermented Bean Curd, New Functional Food
Floral Basket and Gift to Kim Jong Il from Japanese Delegation
Doctorate Awarded to Korean Teacher in Japan
articles.content:
Floral Basket and Gift to Kim Jong Il from Japanese Delegation
    Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket and a gift by the second delegation of Japan for the study of the Juche idea on a visit to the DPRK.
 They were handed to an official concerned by Toshikazu Suzuki, chairman of the Shizuoka Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, who is leading the delegation.

articles.title: Tribute Paid to Kim Po Hyon
articles.content:
Doctorate Awarded to Korean Teacher in Japan
    Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of awarding doctorate to a teacher of Joson University of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) took place at the People�fs Palace of Culture here on Friday.
 Present at the ceremony were Vice-Premier Kwak Pom Gi who is chairman of the DPRK State Commission for Conferring Degrees and Titles and Secretary General of the commission Kang Chun Gum and officials concerned.    
 A decision of the commission was read out and a certificate of doctor of literature and a medal were awarded to O Hyang Suk, a teacher at Joson University, who made a significant contribution to unearthing cultural heritages of the Korean nation and systematizing them in an all-round way on the basis of the Juche-oriented idea and theory on literature and art.

articles.title: Sympathy to French FM
Kim Yong Nam Meets Congratulatory Group of Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Sympathy to French FM
    Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of sympathy to his French counterpart Philippe Douste Blazy.
 The message expressed deep sympathy to the French foreign minister and, through him, to the government and victims and the bereaved families in connection with the airbus crash in the air above the Caribbean Sea which claimed big French casualties on Aug. 16.
